sub_title: Lecturer in Mathematics at Maastricht University; Department of Data Analytics and Digitalisation; School of Business and Economics
summary:
I am a geometric-topologist and my primary area of research is knot theory, braid groups and 3-manifolds. My research focuses on the construction of Jones-type invariants for knots and links in 3-manifolds other than the 3-sphere (skein modules), using knot algebras and Markov traces. Recently, I developed an interest on tied links, on pseudo knots, on knotoids & on weaves/tilings.

Highlights:

1. Teaching Award 2018-2019, China Agricultural University

2. Teaching Award 2017-2018, China Agricultural University

3. Awards for Research 2017 & 2020, China Agricultural University 

4. Research Visits:
i. @ Harbin Engineering University, Dec. 2016 (Campus Visit & talk on Skein Modules) 
ii. @ MF Oberwolfach, Germany, April 2015 (Research In Pairs with S. Lambropoulou and B. Gabrovsek)
iii. @ Derby university, UK, February 2020 (Campus visit and talk on Engineering Mathematics).
iv. @ Leiden University, The Netherlands, March & April 2023.

5. Local organizer of the International Conference on Knots, Low-dimensional topology and applications: Knots in Hellas 2016, International Olympic Academy,  Ancient Olympia, Greece, 16-22 July 2016.

6. Organizer of a 9-week seminar on Low-dimensional topology & Knot theory at China Agricultural University, College of Science, Sept.-Oct. 2019.

treasury_media.title: The Kauffman bracket skein module of the lens spaces via unoriented braids
treasury_media.description: In this paper we develop a braid theoretic approach for computing the Kauffman bracket skein module of the lens spaces L(p,q), KBSM(L(p,q)), for q≠0. For doing this, we introduce a new concept, that of an {\it unoriented braid}. Unoriented braids are obtained from standard braids by ignoring the natural top-to-bottom orientation of the strands. We first define the {\it generalized Temperley-Lieb algebra of type B}, TL1,n, which is related to the knot theory of the solid torus ST, and we obtain the universal Kauffman bracket type invariant, V, for knots and links in ST, via a unique Markov trace constructed on TL1,n. The universal invariant V is equivalent to the KBSM(ST). For passing now to the KBSM(L(p,q)), we impose on V relations coming from the band moves (or slide moves), that is, moves that reflect isotopy in L(p,q) but not in ST, and which reflect the surgery description of L(p,q), obtaining thus, an infinite system of equations. By construction, solving this infinite system of equations is equivalent to computing KBSM(L(p,q)). We first present the solution for the case q=1, which corresponds to obtaining a new basis, Bp, for KBSM(L(p,1)) with (⌊p/2⌋+1) elements. We note that the basis Bp is different from the one obtained by Hoste \& Przytycki. For dealing with the complexity of the infinite system for the case q>1, we first show how the new basis Bp of KBSM(L(p,1)) can be obtained using a diagrammatic approach based on unoriented braids, and we finally extend our result to the case q>1.

treasury_media.description: 6 月 18 日上午，中国农业大学与美国俄克拉荷马州立大学合作举办的农林经济管理 ( 农业商务 ) 专业中外合作办学项目（“中美 OSU 项目”） 2019 届学生毕业典礼暨学生赴美交流典礼在国际学院报告厅隆重举行。今年本项目共有 55 名学生顺利完成学业，另外还有 57 名学生即将赴美交流学习。 中国农业大学副校长龚元石、国际合作与交流处处长冯伟哲、国际学院院长黄冠华、党委书记陈明海等中方领导，美国俄克拉荷马州立大学副校长兼农业科学和自然资源学院院长 Thomas Coon...

projects.title: Conferences & Seminar Talks
projects.description:
Conferences (most recent!)

1. 2023 International Conference on Topology and its Applications, 3-7 July 2023, Nafpaktos, Greece.

2. Inverse Problems Virtual Meeting, 22—24 July 2022. This meeting was part of the AMS-EMS-SMF 2022, 2nd Joint Congress of Mathematics co-organized by the AMS, the EMS and the Société Mathématique de France, 18—22 July 2022, Grenoble, France. Title of talk: Skein modules: A braid theoretic approach.

3. Second Congress of Greek Mathematicians SCGM-2022, Hellenic Mathematical Society, 4—10 July 2022, Athens, Greece. Title of talk: Kauffman bracket skein modules: A braid theoretic approach.

4. Combinatorial and Geometric Knot theory, Mathematisches Forschunginstitute Oberwolfach Hybrid Seminar, Germany, 21—28 November 2021. Title of talk: The Kauffman bracket skein module of the complement of (2, 2p+1)-torus knots via braids.

5. Third Pan-pacific international conference on Topology and Applications, Chengdu, P. R. China, 8 – 13 November 2019. Title of talk: Skein modules: The braid approach.

6. Knots in Hellas 2016, International conference on knots, low-dimensional topology and applications, International Olympic Academy, Ancient Olympia, Greece, 17 – 22 July 2016.
Title of talk: On the Homflypt skein module of the lens spaces L(p,1) via braids.


Seminar Talks (most interesting!)

1. "Knots and representation theory", e-Seminar on Knot Theory and Related Topics, June 20, 2022. Title of talk: Skein modules: A braid theoretic approach.

2. China Agricultural University, School of Science, Department of Mathematics, P. R. China, September--October 2019. Title of seminar: Knot Theory & Low-dimensional topology.

3. Harbin Engineering University, Department of Mathematics, Harbin, P.R. China, December 2016.
Title of talk: Knot theory of 3-manifolds: Skein modules via braids.

4. National Technical University of Athens, One day workshop for high school students, July 2015.
Title of talk: An invitation to Knot Theory.
